description: 'A crack-up at the storytelling meeting' is an audio-visual project which's products are stories that are used as means of communication and try to stimulate the viewer. Those stories are produced in a way to try to contain little specific peices of contemporary culture that are there to try to trigger a certain emotional reaction. The project is based on a book by Harmony Korine titled 'A crack-up at the race riots'. Harmony is a movie director and one of the movies he directed are 'Kids' and 'Gummo'. His narratives are often non-linear and relate to American culture.
